Was with this company for 3 years. I gave a 5-star review last year mostly because of the amazing engineer the company sent to service my boiler. Fast forward a year later, boiler service due and carried out. Different calibre of engineer; not as personable or capable/competent as the young lad sent last year due to the fact that after the service, my boiler started making these awful, scary noises mostly when the heating was turned on. We didn‚Äôt catch on at first because we didn‚Äôt use the heating immediately after service so the first time I noticed was about 9-10 days after the service. I managed to contact them after it had occurred a handful of times (I am also a professional who works full-time, and travels a fair bit and it took another 3/4 days to get around to calling them -once the issue had occurred multiple times). I was told I was outside the 7-day window to report faults after a service. However, no one had reminded me of this at the point of booking said service, engineer hadn‚Äôt given me this information immediately after service and I didn‚Äôt receive my service paperwork after service (although even when I got it, there wasn‚Äôt a reminder on there to contact them if  any problems within a week) so they effectively had breached their own T&Cs. If any or all of these had happened, we‚Äôd have run the heating immediately a handful of times to make sure everything was fine after the service. Anyway, they refused to send an engineer out and their defence was that the contract (which I‚Äôd entered into some 6 months prior) gave that information about the 7-day window. Thus, their ridiculous expectation is for the customer to have a photographic memory and to have memorised every line of the policy (bearing in mind this wasn‚Äôt emphasized verbally at any point) so I was expected to have remembered or even been aware of the 7-day window from looking at pages of T&Cs 6 months prior to the service). I tried to argue that this was an unrealistic expectation and that the customer should get a reminder at the time of booking a service/engineer should mention after service, and then ppw received immediately after  should also highlight this. They refused to send an engineer back out, instead advising they‚Äôd give me a ‚Äòdiscount‚Äô and charge me ¬£65 for a visit. My boiler had been working absolutely fine before service, no complaints throughout the life of the policy, and hadn‚Äôt expressed any concerns about it prior to service. We‚Äôre also a vulnerable household. But instead of coming out to check what their engineer had done to my boiler, they used the get-out-of-jail-free card of policy T&Cs. We also discovered that whatever he‚Äôd done or not done correctly, messed with the thermostats somehow.  I went to the Financial Ombudsman which is effectively now a toothless bulldog, and the outcome was that they couldn‚Äôt speak to what had happened with, and after the service, but the policy said blah blah blah. Needless to say, I have now cancelled my policy. Whilst I was going back and forth with 247, I had to get a qualified mate to check my boiler, to at least give me peace of mind that it wasn‚Äôt about to explode any minute, considering the awful racket it was making after the so-called service. So, buyer beware.

They are getting 1 star as there is no option to give no stars.  They came out and did a first service and from the time the engineer attended and left, the boiler started to act up and the pressure would keep going up and my hot water cut out.  A few days after the engineer left, I called to say I was having issues with the boiler and that the settings weren't working and they said they would send someone out but this never happened.  I rang them twice about this and the first time they said they called and didn't get me (there was no missed calls on my phone). Second time they said it would be a new claim and I would have to pay a call out fee but finally agreed to send someone out after I told them this was still the claim after their engineer had come out.  To date no one came out for that concern.  My boiler subsequently started leaking and I called them and had to pay a ¬£95 call out fee only to be told they needed to strip down the boiler to fix it and I had to pay another ¬£150 as this was not covered in my plan with them.  I did this, they came after much back and forth.  I was out of the country and left someone at the property to give them access and called and provided them with the contact information for the individual, but I kept being called and messaged when I was away trying to bury my family member.  When they finally decided to come out, they were telling me between 8 and 6pm which was utterly unacceptable as some of us do work. They finally agreed to between 8 - 12pm, then on the day they should attend, twice on the day they cancelled the engineers, first saying the engineer was sick and then that the other engineer had an emergency.  Buckets of water were being emptied and they were telling me they couldn't send  anyone out for two further days. It was only after I asked for the matter to be escalated that I was able to get them to come out.....all of this whilst abroad, as they continued to ring me and message throughout, even though I kept telling them to ring the number for the person at the house.  The engineer who finally came out claimed he messaged me an hour before he was due to get to the property but I never got that text.  He looked at the boiler and decided it would cost ¬£500 to repair (which they didn't cover of course) and recommended that I get a new boiler.  They then quoted for a new boiler but could only offer one brand which they were obviously working with.  I advised I would like a choice of brands, but was told they can offer nothing if not the brand they were touting.They are in my view dishonest and misrepresent what they offer, whilst trying to upsell you things when they come out to service your boiler. I now feel like they tampered with my boiler to get me to buy a new one. My boiler was being serviced every year since purchasing it and prior to them attending to do their service, I had never had any issues with it, having put it in new 8 years before.  I would never recommend 24/7 to even my worst enemy.

I have been a loyal customer of 24/7 for over 7 years, paying a monthly premium for their Home Care Plus Package. Every year I got a boiler service as part of the package, but never called them out for anything else. However, last week my hot water wasn't working due to low pressure. An engineer attended my property, part of the package,  and fixed the issue within seconds. Miraculously when he looked at his next job, he surprisingly stated that its my house and due for an annual service. This is where it all cam tumbling down. He came out with a list of things that were needed service the boiler, at an additional cost of ¬£328.00, not covered by my premium cover policy. He also stated that if they open up the boiler, there could be other issue and could cost an additional ¬£800 on top (¬£1,228.00) in total. I was shocked, given I was paying a premium for their most prestigious package for years and they would not fix my boiler, as it doesn't cover the parts or labour cost. I then suggested, in that case I have new bolier cover with 24/7 which they put me to a tea of sales people, that stated the cover is not for a new boiler but ¬£400 towards a new one. I asked for the cost an they were trying to push me into an unheard of model costing 4 times more, even with the ¬£400 discount than any other company ( i received several quotes). With all this I asked to CANCEL the policy as I thought it was absurd they were ripping me off as a loyal customer. Im then told it will cost ¬£289.00 to cancel the policy as I had a annual service, which was part of the policy. Ultimately, I paid a premium for years, to be ripped of and when I want to leave they continue to request more money. Their customer service team is based in India and they say many things that are not true to keep your business. REMEMBER, you are paying a monthly premium which is contractual under their T&Cs they don't tell you about, and practically everything that will go wrong with a boiler or heating is not covered. You will pay more! AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

I then did some research and realised they were charging a lot more than other company's for a new boiler and the new boiler insurance was a 10 year direct debit which they did not tell me about. They also did not tell me that I was entitled to a ¬£250 discount as I had a policy with them. I cancelled the new boiler but the company did not give me back my ¬£700 deposit. We have had cover with this company since 2020 without incident. In 2022 we had a new boiler installed by Bosch. The boiler was serviced the next Summer 2023 by this company.¬† The engineer that serviced the boiler was lovely and very chatty, at the end of the service she told that everything was fine and there were no issues. Last week the second boiler service was carried out, this time the engineer advised that the hinges on the front panel were broken, this was a shock as this panel had not been touched since the service the prior year during the boiler service.When he was done the bottom left side of the front panel had slipped and you could see a visible gap, he said that it needs to be repaired asap as this could compromise the function of the boiler. He also told me that if you're not familiar with this brand of boiler and don't take care when removing the panel, you will snap the hinges. I received a call from customer service the next day, they were providing a quote to repair the hinges it was going to cost us ¬£129! I questioned this and was told that the previous engineer had noted the broken hinges in her report, funny she never mentioned this to me and I never received a follow up call to have this rectified, which is what I thought the boiler service was for;¬† find and fix any faults, otherwise what are we paying for? Outrageous! Because they use contractors any damage caused when servicing a boiler would be a chargeback to the engineer, which is why she didn't mention it to me and made it seem that this was the way she found it. In the end we contacted Bosch and they arranged to have the hinges replaced. Needless to say I've cancelled this cover as I can't tust the integrity of their contractors. We will be paying more for Bosch to carry out the annual service, but at least we will have peace of mind.

247 Home Scam should be the real name of the company. So this is how it works:1. You call boiler not working. Engineer (so called) turns up 5 minutes later without opening the cover tells the unspecting tenant major works needed company will be in touch.2. You get a call from the company new boiler sales team, very very concerned your boiler is beyond economic repair because thier engineer has condemmed the boiler due to extensive parts needed to be changed & the boiler being substandard and old. Its a Main(Baxi) boiler and 8 years old! so you ask how much is it well for you just around 2400 pounds.3. You refuse they cancel your cover, I asked for a copy of the engineers report which has this on it "premier sensor resistance was very low 3.5kom, also they advised that the PCB was faulty and required replacement.‚ÄØ"4.Flumexed how he could have gaterd all this information without opening the panel & Baxi advised all this without any being on site I called Baxi! I am aure you can guess what they said... no call received regarding my boiler serial number and there is no way they could have diagosed this or nay one could have without being on site and no one knows what this premier sensor is on thier boiler.5. Stumped and out of options I ask them how much will they charge for a repair ¬£443.00 is the figure that came back with! fair does to them the lady said you could pay this over 12 months and the boiler will be covered for the 12 months too, they wanted the last engineers report so they could make sure they had the parts on the van, so that is when I had called you the customer services and they said we can also het the manufacturer out for  a repair at he cost of some 265 pounds, never offered this before! only a boiler replacement! 6. Had already paid the Baxi guys and they had confirmed they will turn up the next day so kept them on. They did turn up the next day first thing in the morning and lo and behold there was nothing wrong with the boiler except the timer on the boiler was off no PCB no fictitious  premier sensor.... nothing at all. 7. Fuming that I had been had and almost fell prey to 24/7 high pressure sales tactics I wrote an email to their complaint team wanting to know how does a boiler with a timer switched off get diagnosed as beyond economic repair... and my policy terminated because I didn't accept their new boiler.. Their complaints department wouldn't take any names  on a public forum came back with a 20 pound compensation as a good will gesture and I am ¬£443 down. Needless to state I will be filing a complaint with the financial ombudsman today. 8. They had done the same thing on another property of mine a week before as they filed its CP12 on routine seals which British Gas & Main both have confirmed are service items and must be changed on service inspection, lo and behold I get a call from their new boiler team stating your perfectly operational Valliant Boiler needs replacing as its too old and seals are failing!!!!! What worries me  how many people has fallen victim to these scamsters.... any one who has please speak out, so others especially the old  don't fall victim to the unscrupulous methods of this company.

We've been with 247 Home Rescue for two or three years.  Our policy includes an annual boiler service.  Previously there's been no problem, but this year . . . .I received a reminder that a service was due and went online to book it.  It said all appointments for this month were booked . . . and next month . . . and the month after.  I went a year forward in their calendar and it was still showing no appointments available.  So my husband rang up - because we thought there must be a fault on the website - and he was told that, yes, all appointments were booked for the next year.  Not much point in having a policy that includes a service if there's no one to carry it out.  The person on the helpdesk said they would 'phone us when an appointment became available.  After two weeks and no 'phone call, my husband 'phoned again and was told "We can send someone today."  Yes please!  Several hours later they rang to say "The engineer can't do today but he can come some time tomorrow."  We had made plans for the day but, since it's important to get the boiler serviced before the cold weather sets in, we stayed in all day, waiting for the engineer - who didn't come.  My husband tried ringing the company but, clearly, there's no one on the boiler service helpdesk at the weekend, because when he pressed the button suggested he just got a recorded message saying the engineer would ring half and hour before he arrived.  Neither of which things happened.We will ring again on Monday but I'm not holding out much hope.  And when our policy is up for renewal we shall be looking elsewhere for cover.

I've had the policy for many years and two sucesful repais. Premium was very cheap but I'm now giving up on it.Ihave a flat where the pipes are behind walls or under floors.I had a leak in the bathroom which was showing up on the floor. To get to the leak the plumber would have needed to access the pipe through the wall. This is turned out was not covered in the policy. The leak must be visible for it to be repaired. The relevent clause says no investigation or access is inlucded. As far as I am concerend this makes the claim to cover plumbing worthless as in most cases the source of the leak is not visible as most pipes are behind walls (unless your home is the Pompidou Centre). Most plumbers do know how to access pipes behind walls in my experience.

IT'S A SCAM, can't believe they are allowed to operate as an emergency service, I have their HOME CARE PLUS policy which is their premium policy and guess what, they provide heating and boiler breakdown and the rest,  I have contacted them regarding an issue I have with my radiators not getting warm , so the engineer came out and checked everything and told me he will be back and someone will contact regarding an appointment,  sure enough they did call me and asked me to pay ¬£146 for the repair,  I believed that I had INSURANCE against this kind of cost,  they said we will cover the parts and labour but we can't drain the system,  now if anyone knows little bit about heating system that if you want to carry out any job regarding radiators or boiler you need to take water out which is draining the system that is basic,  guess what that part which is draining the system to carry out any jobs is NOT COVERED,  and they gave me the price of ¬£146 odd to open one small bolt to let the water out it's a pure SCAM,  SAVE your self hassle and time,  do not go near them , they PRICE looks very attractive but you won't get anything in return,  DON'T waste your MONEY IT'S A SCAM.

This scam& dodgy company has broken my healthy boiler and has very very poor serviceAvoid this dodgy company.Read my review carefully& I tell you how they play dirty&break your healthy boiler to be able to sell you a new boiler& steal your money.You pay them around ¬£200-250 annually for their landlord care plan.Then you call them multiple times to arrange for a boiler annual service&landlord gas safety certificate.My tenants didn't have any issues with the boiler at all before the engineer's visit&it was working perfectly.The tenant took a day off work&stayed home between 8am-6pm.Their staff who are based in India and Pakistan call you 2-3 times on the same day before the engineer's visit&push you to sell you a new boiler&if you decline it then they try to sell you their company products like descaler, inhibitors etc.When you decline their products again then engineer won't turn up for the appointment on the day&waste your time&money.Then you arrange another appointment&engineer attend the 2nd appointment after weeks if you are lucky then he told us the boiler is faulty &needs to be repaired but he tells you " IT IS NOT COVERED BY YOUR POLICY" & you have to pay extra in spite of having no issues with the boiler at all! I made a huge mistake& trusted them and I paid ¬£210&the engineer falsely claims he fixed the boiler but no Landlord Safety Certificate or no other repair report was given to me by the engineer or by 24/7.Then, my tenants experienced issues with the hot water the day after the repair.Then hot water stopped completely a week after repair!!! I complained to them straight away then they ask me to pay ¬£95 to book an engineer appointment to fix their fault. They are an absolute joke and very dodgy. My tenants took a day off again&stayed home again 8am-6pm but engineer didn't turn up again for 2nd time in 2 wks.My tenants&I are very disappointed&very frustrated with this fake and scam company. My tenants took 2 days off work but the engineers didn't show up twice and wasted my tenants time and money. I complained to them&cancelled my all policies immediately&they offered me only ¬£25 which is an absolute joke!While they took around ¬£500 from me&created a fake job&didn't do anything and broke my healthy boiler.I have spoken to different staffs multiple times who are based mainly in India&Pakistan&Eastern Europe& requested full refund of ¬£210 as there was no issues with boiler before the engineer's visit.The engineer are unprofessional, incompetent& useless &they took advantage of our trust&made up a fake job&damaged the healthy boiler. My tenants lost money and time because they stayed home twice but the engineer didn't turn up twice.It's very unprofessional company with very poor service which only takes money every month but when you desperately need them, they don't care about you at all. Don't get fooled with their reviews, I don't believe it at all. If customers miss the appointment then customers have to pay ¬£30 penalty each time, however the engineer failed to attend twice while my tenants stayed home the whole day and they didn't offer us any money. Their customer service is absolutely rubbish and you have to call them many times and chase them and they keep you waiting for over 15 min with no luck to solve your problem. Now, I have called 2 different boiler engineers from different companies and they checked the boiler and they informed me the previous engineer has broken the boiler and it cost around ¬£1000 to fix it or better to buy a new boiler. The tenant didn't have any issues at all with the boiler before the visit by 24/7 engineer and he deliberately has broken the healthy boiler and I am absolutely disgusted. So, please be aware of this scam company with incompetent and fake engineers. I cancelled my other policies with them and I advise you to cancel your policies straight away and save you time and money. But if you decide to keep the policy, make sure, you stand next to the engineer when he visit your boiler. And if he tells you the boiler is faulty or at risk etc, don't believe him and don't trust him at all and get a second opinion from a different engineer from a different company. Because 24/7 is a SCAM and dodgy company!

Upon the call to arms, our home faced a chill which knew no mercy, and in this darkest hour, the boiler fell into silence. But fear not, for our salvation arrived in the form of an intrepid engineer, a paragon of expertise and resolve. From the moment he crossed the threshold, his demeanor was one of calm assurance and unwavering focus. With tools in hand and knowledge abundant, he embarked on his noble mission to restore warmth to the hearth. Methodical and precise, he inspected and toiled, undeterred by the complexities that lay before him.His work was not merely a repair but an exhibition of mastery. Each turn of the wrench, each measured adjustment, was executed with a grace that bespoke years of experience. Patiently, he explained the process, ensuring that we, the grateful recipients of his toil, understood the care being taken.In less time than it takes to recount, the boiler roared back to life, an anthem of victory over cold and discomfort. We stand warmed not only by the heat of our radiator but by the knowledge that such stewards of craft exist. For those in need of a guiding hand through the battlefield of broken boilers, our engineer stands ready‚Äîundaunted and ever steadfast. Truly, this was a service rendered with fortitude worthy of high praise.

247 are proactive in arranging for your annual boiler inspection. They contact you when a gas service engineer is in the area, so no 'jumping through hoops' etc as you would have to with some of the major companies when you want them to provide what you pay for. So far, this has meant that my boiler has been serviced at more frequent than every 12 months, which is a positive and a bonus indeed. Thomas, the service appliance engineer who attended, lives locally and is very friendly and gave positive reassurances about the condition of my boiler, instilling me with confidence about it's reliability over the coming winter months. Their monthly charges are also only about half of what I would pay with the likes of British Gas. Well worth it when you consider that prior to taking out cover I had to pay ¬£400 for a emergency plumber to attend for a failed boiler about two years ago during winter.

I was with 247 home rescue for the last 4 years, I recently had an issue with my boiler (no hot water, no heating) I contacted 247 home rescue regarding this, after completing several checks I was told I needed to pay ¬£95 excess for a claim, I paid this, they then told me it would be 5 days before an engineer could arrive, this is how they treat emergencies üò≥I get a call from the engineer and he tries to help me through a video call to get the boiler working, he can't believe that 247 home rescue are leaving me with no heating or hot water for 5 days (I have a young family)The boiler did not respond to any attempts to get it working, over the phone the plumber tells me the boiler fan is needing replaced, he will let 247 know this.The next I know, 247 call me and tell me that my boiler is BER (beyond economical repair) I have either to pay for full repair or pay for replacement boiler... I'm like "what on earth am I paying insurance for? üò≥They then send quotes for replacing boiler for ¬£3000. The next email I get from 247 home rescue is them informing me they have cancelled my insurance policy with them, stating that the boiler is too old and BER (they knew the age of it yet happily took the monthly premium prior to this for years) as they had cancelled the insurance policy, I contacted my bank and cancelled the direct debit, that was on the 28/10/24Two days later, I receive an email and text message from them regarding me cancelling the direct debit, the message states "to avoid cancellation fee being charged, we have reinstated your direct debit and policy" WTF! Seems a nice earner, take the monthly payments for insurance, when policy holder puts in a claim 247 home rescue just pull the rug and don't pay out, they knew the age of the boiler but at no time was any advice given, so as well as the monthly premiums + the ¬£95 excess I paid to be told, "I'm no longer insured" I paid ¬£260 out of my own pocket to get boiler repaired and was told by the engineer that my boiler could work away for years to come.Do not use this company! üò°

Complaint - Home Rescue 247 - 1st Nov 2024  Please forward this complaint to the CEO of Home Rescue 247. My wife and I are both in their 70s, with a severely bed-bound disabled daughter, whom we care for.  For our peace of mind, we took out a Home Rescue Plus 247 plan to receive the highest level of cover for our Worcester Bosch ‚Äì Greenstar ‚Äì 440CDi Boiler and any Plumbing issues. I am a new customer of Home Rescue 247 I had to call an engineer out to deal with our central heating system and a water leak on the central heating pipe. The engineer arrived late on Friday afternoon on the 1st Nov. He stated that we don‚Äôt cover Worcester Bosch ‚Äì Greenstar ‚Äì 440CDi Boiler and as such I can‚Äôt touch the system. Furthermore, I cannot repair the water leak as it would involve him opening up floorboards on the landing and he is not allowed to do this. I said I find this strange as where would one expect the pipework to be located in the house other than some running beneath the floorboards? He said to take it up with the company. It came across to me that the engineer did not want to do the work as it was late Friday afternoon. I became frustrated and extremely disappointed but did not wish to argue with him. He has left us in the lurch without any consideration for our predicament. I have found Home Rescue to be dishonest in offering the cover they promised, and as such I strongly advise and recommend that people look for an alternative trustworthy supplier.  I am an extremely disheartened customer. Nobody from Home Rescue 247 has got back to me to discuss the matter.I hope to receive an appropriate compensation.Thank you.M I Essa (Retired Magistrate)Bolton

This company uses very dubious hard sell techniques. When their engineer arrived to do my annual service he immediately told me I needed a new boiler and showed me a few small nodules on the heat exchanger saying that‚Äôs about to go and you need a new boiler. This set alarm bells going so I took pictures and sent them to gas fitter friend. His assessment was that there was no imminent danger of the boiler breaking down. But if there was a problem with the heat exchanger Worcester Bosh would replace it if the boiler was under ten years old and charge only for labour. If 247 were reputable they should have known this and advised me accordingly. Within half an hour of the engineer leaving I received a call from the 247 salesman offering to quote me for a new boiler which I declined.Because the 247 engineer had worried me I contacted the manufacturer Worcester Bosh who sent their own engineer a few days later.On taking the cover off the boiler the Worcester Bosh engineer described what I had been told by the 247 engineer as ‚ÄúNonsense‚ÄùHe declined to change the heat exchanger as it didn‚Äôt need replacing. He carried out a full service and pointed out several parts of the service which had not been done by  247. When I mentioned this to 247 they replied that they only do a visual check. Does this actually constitute a service??So cutting the story short , 247 said they had acted correctly and  it was my decision to accept their advice or not.  I believe it was just a blatant attempt to sell me a boiler I didn‚Äôt need. I ended up reluctantly paying a fee to cancel my contract because I certainly didn‚Äôt want 247 back at my house again!

AVOID AVOID AVOID!!!The good first - the response time is great!The Negative, and there is a lot - I've previously insured my Boiler for around 5 Years with Domestic and General and Homeserve (who are fantastic) so I am not naive in relation to expectations.I booked my Free Boiler Service with 24/7 - they failed to show for an all day appointment twice - after much negotiation I was given ¬£25 as compensation for two wasted days.My first repair (¬£95 Call Out) - My (New) Washing Machine was situated below my Boiler, the Engineer who visited scratched all the front with his tools in his Work Trousers - I reported it immediately, but they denied any liabilty and shut me down.Now the important stuff - My second repair, PCB Fault - part ordered by Engineer and a call from them within an hour, if your Boiler is of any age then this policy is useless. The reason for the prompt call becomes apparant - they stated the Boiler was beyond economical repair. Because my Boiler was 9 Years old they added depreciation so valued it at ¬£350, the cost of the repair was ¬£390.  I asked if I could pay the extra ¬£40, they refused.  They then offered me a new Boiler at ¬£2900 but they would contribute ¬£400 - I declined and asked for the ¬£400 or at least the write off value (¬£350) they declined.This is all in your Terms and Conditions, I should have read them, granted, but surely when I took out the Policy this should have been highlighted as you won't get many repairs for under ¬£400 in the current climate.Never again - awful Company, use D&G or Homeserve - they are Fantastic!

Absolutely terrible service. I have held a policy since 2023 on a new boiler. A condition of the boilers warranty is that it is serviced annually, to this end I had the boiler serviced by 24/7 on 09/02/2023. In turn the next annual service needed to be completed February 2024, however every time I made an attempt to book a service via the app I received a message to tell me that 'Your service is due February 2025, we will contact you nearer the time'. Clearly this was an erroneous message as this would mean that my boiler had not been serviced in February 2024, a service for which I have paid as part of my 24/7 policy. Despite repeated phone calls to 24/7 to enquire as to why my boiler was not services in February 2024 my boiler has still not been serviced. I have again chased 24/7 today, and have been told that the earliest that they are able to service my boiler is 23/01/2025. In essence this will be a 2 year interval between boiler service, which in turn will invalidate the warranty on my new boiler. To say I am annoyed would be an understatement. I have been charged for a service which hasn't been provided, and due to the lack of service by 24/7 the warranty on my new boiler has been invalidated. I will be contacting the Financial Ombudsman Service to raise a complaint, this is not the way to run a business, absolute shambles!

As you can see, I initially gave this company a five-star review, as many customers likely do. They are very clever at promising everything a customer wants to hear during the first contact, particularly in an emergency. This makes it easy for people to leave positive reviews right after their initial experience. However, they never ask for feedback on the actual repair work or its outcome, which is where the real problems arise.I recently had two claims‚Äîone for a boiler issue and one for a plumbing problem‚Äîand the experience has been shocking.Boiler Claim:When the engineer visited, they claimed that my recently installed boiler was eight years old (it is only four years old) and marked it as ‚Äúat risk.‚Äù This designation meant that any repairs would be entirely my responsibility, and the company refused to do anything under the policy. Furthermore, they demanded a full strip service, which I would also have to pay for. Essentially, they offered no service or support but still labeled the boiler as ‚Äúat risk.‚ÄùWhat‚Äôs worse is that the boiler was still under warranty, yet the engineer made no effort to check. Instead, they simply declared it ‚Äúat risk‚Äù to push me into paying ¬£2,800 for a replacement boiler. It was clear the engineer‚Äôs main goal was to exploit any opportunity to force me to pay thousands of pounds for the company‚Äôs profit. The complaints department later justified this by saying the engineer had done nothing wrong, claiming that treating a lie about four-year-old boiler as eight years old was ‚Äúacceptable.‚Äù This reasoning is not only misleading but also insulting.Plumbing Claim:The plumbing issue was handled no better. They sent a plumber who plunged the toilet without resolving the blockage. When I reported that the issue seemed to be more serious and likely required further investigation, I was told their plumbing service only covers basic plunging and does not include any investigation or deeper repairs. As a result, the toilet remained blocked, and they refused to send anyone back.Conclusion:Labeling equipment ‚Äúat risk‚Äù is just a tactic to shift all costs onto the customer while the company takes no responsibility. The boiler replacement and full strip service which not being covered are purely profit-driven schemes, and the engineers seem focused only on finding ways to pressure customers into expensive payments. The fact that they make no effort to honor service or resolve genuine issues is beyond disgusting.I want to warn others to be cautious about trusting this company, as they only interested in making money rather than honour the serviceHere‚Äôs the revised version:Subject: Follow-Up on ComplaintI‚Äôm following up regarding the company‚Äôs delayed response. They finally called me back today, three days later than they were supposed to, the manager claiming the delay was because ‚Äúmy number on their system was incorrect.‚Äù This is clearly a lie‚Äîif the number was wrong, how were they able to call me now? Such an excuse is both insulting and unprofessional.What‚Äôs even worse is that, despite the delay, they stated they wouldn‚Äôt be able to do anything to resolve the issue anyway. According to their complaints department who contacted me again to claim again that  the engineer falsely claiming that my four-year-old boiler was eight years old is somehow deemed ‚Äúacceptable.‚Äù If I am dissatisfied with it, I may refer my complaint to the Financial Ombudsman Service.‚ÄØ This response is nothing short of a joke, and it‚Äôs clear they have no intention of taking accountability for their actions.I strongly recommend avoiding this company if you can. Their practices are deceptive, their service unreliable, and their excuses nothing but lies!

The service is shocking!I had my annual boiler service booked for 4th December 2024 this was booked and confirmed with 247 on 8th October 2024 that is 8 weeks in advance. I received a text from 247 today at 16:30 to tell me that the appointment for tomorrow has been cancelled, due to unforeseen circumstances and I must book another date. The next available date is 19/02/2025, 11 weeks later, not acceptable, what a joke! Because I had booked this boiler service well in advance I arranged to take a day of work for the day of the service. I now have wasted day tomorrow because of the late notice. Not good enough and wished I had never accepted the renewal of the policy in January. I will be sure not to accept the renewal again. I will be paying for a better service from another provider. After I complained they managed to arrange an engineer to complete my service on Wednesday 11th December, amazingly. The engineer turned up and spent less than 20 minutes completing the thorough service and add the addictive that I paid an additional ¬£39.99 apparently. I say apparently because he left no paperwork at all to explain what he had apparently done within the 20 minute visit. It is more than Shocking service its a JOKE.

The engineer came out and tried to repair the heat exchanger but ended up snapping a screw on one of the electrodes which meant we needed a new one.  The Company "247 Home Rescue" then decided it was not cost effective to fit a new one as the bill for parts and labour would be around ¬£600.  They calculated that my boiler was 8 years old and they would not do any repair costing more than ¬£250! (Beware of this loophole). They terminated my contract and sent me a quote for a new boiler.I then contacted British Gas and explained the situation.  I took a Homecare agreement out with them for a similar monthly payment, they arrived the next day, fit a new heat exchanger and its been fine ever since. My problem with this Company is that their engineer snapped the screw which caused the problem and then the Company refused to repair the boiler because the work was going to cost more than ¬£250.  My yearly premium was more than ¬£250!   This same engineer has been coming to the property for 4 years and had been the only person to have ever worked on the boiler.  He did the annual service every year, the last one being 3 weeks before this incident.

I had boiler service and cover.Positives - boiler engineer for the service was very good and helpful.I did not have to use the 24/7 callout so I don't know if it is any good.Negatives - in order to book the service, they call you and start asking for personal details to confirm who you are. I was then offered a service at short notice. It feels exactly like the start of a scam and is very disconcerting. Why can't you book online? Why can you only choose the next day or no day at all? Also, my renewal price is almost double, which is fine, but when I wanted to cancel (ie turn off autorenew) this cannot be done online and has to be done on the phone. Why? This is unacceptable. Judging from other comments I'm sceptical as to whether the autorenewal will actually be switched off... So I will also cancel the direct debit to be on the safe side, and follow up my cancellation with an email.

I was with 247 Home Rescue for about 2 years. When the time came to get a boiler service booked the engineer did not show. In the first year I was able to rectify this by chasing them to get another engineer to attend. However, in the second year I couldn't book an engineer on their online booking form and when I then had to contact someone via email or phone the engineer did not show up at the property again. To be honest I couldn't be bothered to chase them again to get another engineer booked in, it is in their service agreement that they should get an engineer to provide a service for my boiler and I shouldn't have to chase them for this each year. So I decided to leave and go to a different company.Secondly, when it came to renewing my cover I decided to cancel this renewal. I received a phone call from the company, even though I had specified in my cancellation email to them I did not want them to call me, just to cancel the renewal. When I spoke to the employee on the phone they went through the usual process of trying to offer me a better deal, but after some consideration my decision didn't change. The customer service advisor then kept offering me the same prices and repeating themselves to which I said no I just want to cancel. I kept saying I do not want to renew because I want to go with someone else, you're prices don't make enough different. This went on maybe one or two more times. I then said look I just want to cancel the renewal, I then get asked 'why?' in a reasonably annoyed tone. Making it sound like my reasons were not justified or relevant. I responded to this last question by saying I don't have to give you a reason, I don't want to renew the policy please cancel it. The advisor then tried to offer me the same prices AGAIN to which I said look just cancel the policy I don't want to go through this again. Their tone changed again, like as if I had made it a personal choice on them, they then finally cancelled the renewal.I understand some people may be passionate about what they do and the company they work for, but when I've said 3 times I want to cancel, explained why then get asked why again it is just frustrating. I don't have to give a reason, if I don't want your product then I don't want it, just cancel the renewal. It made me feel as though I was going to be forced into continuing the following year. I don't love being called either just randomly by companies, I'd rather email or do this online for this exact reason, and arguing with me for why I want to leave is not going to change my mind, but confirm my opinion. In reality I should really be refunded for the lack of their boiler service as well! I do not feel that I was rude or disrespectful but I felt the advisor was to me. I probably wouldn't use them again unless their prices were significantly better than everyone else's.

It would be impossible to list all the issues I have had with 247 Home Rescue over boiler 'cover.' In brief: 1) The boiler was neither serviced nor fixed within 13 months, despite the monthly fee; 2) When a fault was discovered, the cause of the fault was mis-diagnosed by the 247HR engineer (an independent engineer showed me that there was no fault in the named parts - the sump and the manifold); 3) I was initially charged for a chemical that was never used (as no work had been done) and received only a refund of this and my exit fee (not the year's fees charged beforehand);4) I had to fight for both refunds;5) Their communication leaves much to be desired.What this company lacks in service it makes up for with the crude tick-box and rapid stone-walling of its complaints' process. No matter how clearly you document your facts and provide evidence, you will get little recompense, as they are unregulated by the financial ombudsman and they know it. They returned fees that they should never have charged in the first place (by their own admission), but not the year's fees for zero service.

Had an issue where my hot water wasn‚Äôt getting hot and my heating was stuck on all the time, and wouldn‚Äôt turn off no matter what I did.Contacted 247 on Boxing Day (This happened on Christmas Eve, but being nice I didn‚Äôt want to have to call an engineer out on Christmas Day) Turns out the earliest an engineer could attend anyway was 30th December. He quickly identified a fault in a switch which would need to be replaced. He said he would contact 247 to get approval to go ahead and would either return that day or on 31st.In preparation for doing the work, he turned off the heating to drain the system.He didn‚Äôt return on 30th and by lunchtime on 31st I called 247 back for an update, only to be told they were still awaiting the engineers report and quotation before they could authorise the repair. They were not interested that I live with my elderly mother who they have left with no heating for 2 days and said they should have the report by the end of today or possibly tomorrow and would call me back then.I asked to speak to a manager but was told there is a 24 hour wait for a managers call back.So now we have another day in a freezing cold house, with no heating or hot water.I doubt I will get a call back from a manager having read some other reviews, but I do hope I am proved wrong.This was my first ever time of having to call them out for an issue, and I am not impressed with their Customer Service, the agent was the most disinterested she could possibly be.Definitely avoid this company, I certainly won‚Äôt be renewing with them next year.UPDATEA manager did call me and was apologetic, said they had now received the information from the engineer and had agreed to the fix, but it required a drain down of the system, which I‚Äôm not covered for (even though I have the top level of cover) so another ¬£108 spent (discounted from ¬£145 due to the inconvenience) and now 1 day later and still no sign of the engineer, so another day/night sat in a freezing cold house with no heating or hot water.
